lineFollowerSim

Class LFS

  • java.lang.Object
    • lineFollowerSim.LFS

  • public class LFS
extends java.lang.Object
    LFS Class is Line Follower Simulator main class that handles:
    • tracking the position and heading of a virtual robot based on user specified target speed and turn rate
    • managing robot acceleration and speed (drive and turn) subject to simulator maximums
    • generating the view of immediate surroundings of a robot
    • reading sensor values from user defined spot and line sensors
    • presentation of an image of the course with robot image and cookie crumb trail tracking progress of robot
    • implements interactive marker system allowing storing multiple robot start locations and headings on a course
    • managing list of contest courses with optional starting location and heading, also timer mode stopwatch or lap time
    • managing contest states and producing contest run report

    Using LFS features, user controller code reads sensor data, updates internal state, and finally sets robot target speed and turn rate. The "internal state" being the fun bit. This is where things get interesting in the case of a complex line following course such as the Dallas Personal Robotics Group (dprg.org) Challenge Course where there are a number of different course features.

    During contest run, robot location and heading queries (e.g. getRobotHeading() ) are unavailable. User may implement their own odometry, but the simulation is not guaranteed to be free from deliberate introduction of some error. For example there may be some errors introduced in speed control and turn rate control beyond errors introduced due to finite time step and limited numerical precision.

    Using the marker system introduced in library release 1.0.3 and later is documented in Marker tab of LFS_SimpleRobotMarker example, including steps required to modify existing LFS sketch to add this functionality.

    Note that several methods documented are not called by user code. These are highlighted by

    (Called by simulation core code.)

    Author:
    Ron Grant Line Follower Sim (LFS) Processing Library published at http://github.com/ron-grant/LFS

    • Field Detail

      • reportDistanceTraveled

        public boolean reportDistanceTraveled
        When set true, report data written to data folder file "contest.cdf" after a run, will include distance traveled since start. If an old contest.cdf exists, it will not have the Dist field in its header. Erasing the file will cause LFS to generate a new contest.cdf file, containing Dist field, after the next contest run.

      • showDistanceTraveled

        public boolean showDistanceTraveled
        When set true (default value), on screen display includes distance traveled since start. New feature in (lib 1.4.1) default is false. See UserInit tab in simulation app.

      • sensors

        public Sensors sensors
        Sensors class single instance - gives access to spot and line sensor lists.

      • simContestFilename

        public java.lang.String simContestFilename
        Contest run report appended to this file. If fields added and header does not match data. Copy file as needed and delete. New column header will be created on next contest run.

      • nameFirst

        public java.lang.String nameFirst
        User first name supplied by call to setFirstNameLastNameRobotName

      • nameLast

        public java.lang.String nameLast
        User last name supplied by call to setFirstNameLastNameRobotName

      • nameRobot

        public java.lang.String nameRobot
        User robot name supplied by call to setFirstNameLastNameRobotName

      • courseDPI

        public int courseDPI
        course resolution in dots/inch, Standard (default) value is 64.

        public LapTimer lapTimer

    • Constructor Detail

      • LFS

        public LFS(PApplet parent)
        Parameters:
        parent - reference to processing applet (PApplet) creating instance of LFS. "this" specified by caller One instance of LFS should be created in your program. For example in the Processing setup method include the line:

        lfs = new LFS(this);

        Parameters:
        show - Set to false to hide display indicating sensor sampling location

      • controllerIsEnabled

        public boolean controllerIsEnabled()

        Returns:
        true if controller is enabled

      • setCourseDPI

        public void setCourseDPI(int dpi)
        Alter the default course scale of 64 dots per inch (DPI). Designing courses with larger DPI values will result in larger couse bitmaps which may cause problems if GPU hardware/memory is not able to handle very large texture maps (bitmaps). Smaller values may result in difficulty resolving features, but also would increase performance, i.e., simulation frame rate.
        Parameters:
        dpi - Dots per inch of course image, should match course image design scale, e.g. export resolution off application creating / editing course.

      • defineRobotViewport

        public void defineRobotViewport(int x,
                                int y,
                                int width,
                                int height)
        Define robot view display region in screen coordinates. This viewport is scaled version of 64 DPI frame buffer rendered for robot sensor pixel sampling.

        TBD - might be requirement that aspect ratio is maintained. Might consider only width parameter with auto calculation of height if this is the case. - RDG Sept 19, 2020.

        (Called by simulation core code)

        Parameters:
        x - upper left corner x
        y - upper left corner y
        width - viewport width
        height - viewport height

      • updateSensors

        public void updateSensors(int r,
                          int g,
                          int b,
                          int a)
        Draw internal bitmap of robot proximity and update sensor data values. Called from draw() at each simulation step.

        (Called by simulation core code.)

        Parameters:
        r - Red color channel 0..255
        g - Green color channel 0..255
        b - Blue color channel 0..255
        a - Alpha opacity 0..255 (0=transparent .. 255 = opaque)

      • clearSensors

        public void clearSensors()
        Clear both spot and line sensor lists. Generally speaking this operation would not be required, but is performed before robot is reset and run. Where sensor definitions are re-instated via call to userInit() which sould contain sensor initialization code.

      • drawRobotAndCourseViews

        public void drawRobotAndCourseViews(int rvDiv,
                                    int cvDiv,
                                    boolean cRotate90)
        Draw robot view and course views to screen. Divider variable 0=disable view, 1= draw every frame, 2 = every other frame (every two draw() calls), 3 every third frame (draw() call)... This allows throttling view updates which may be helpful if graphics performance is limited. The robot view is always rendered to an internal bitmap at fixed 64 DPI resolution to be available for spot and line sensor sample acquisition for each simulation time step. If either "div" value is greater than one this will be temporarily overridden whenever either mouse button is pressed to facilitate better animation of robot drag or rotation, especially if either value is set to large number e.g. (2,30) where course view is being updated very infrequently.

        (Called by simulation core code.)

        Parameters:
        rvDiv - Robot view divider 0=disable 1=every draw() 2=every two draw() calls, 3=...
        cvDiv - Course view divider 0=disable 1=every draw() 2=every two draw() calls, 3=...
        cRotate90 - Rotate course 90 if true

      • setAccRate

        public void setAccRate(float acc)
        Specify robot acceleration rate in inches/sec^2 units. Used when new target speed is greater than current speed. That is, per simulation timestep (dt) speed = speed + acc * dt, where speed is in inches/sec units.
        Parameters:
        acc - acceleration rate

      • setDecelRate

        public void setDecelRate(float dcel)
        Specify robot deceleration rate in inches/sec^2 units. Used when new target speed is less than current speed. That is, per simulation timestep (dt) speed = speed - dcel * dt, where speed is in inches/sec units.
        Parameters:
        dcel - deceleration rate

      • setTurnAcc

        public void setTurnAcc(float turnAcc)
        Specify robot turn rate acceleration and deceleration rates in degrees/sec^2 units used when new target turn rate is less or greater than current turn rate. For example, new turnRate greater than current turRate, per simulation time step (dt), turnRate = turRate + turnAcc*dt Likewise if new turnRate is less than current, turnRate = turnRate-turnAcc*dt. In each case overshoot or undershoot of targetTurnRate is corrected such that turnRate equals targetTurnRate.
        Parameters:
        turnAcc - turn acceleration/deceleration rate in degrees/sec^2 Note: unlike drive speed, turn acceleration and deceleration is symmetrical (equal values).

      • setMaxSpeed

        public void setMaxSpeed(float m)
        Inform LFS of your maximum robot drive speed (inches/sec). If simulation limits are exceeded, a warning message is generated and the value is limited to simulator maximum. Note driving and turning must take into consideration maxim turn rate and maximum drive speed where robot turning model assumes, differential drive robot with turn about center line applying uniform increase of speed of one wheel and decrease in speed of other wheel to effect turn.
        Parameters:
        m - maximum speed

      • getMaxSpeed

        public float getMaxSpeed()
        Get maximum robot speed as defined by simulator or a lesser speed as set by call to setMaxSpeed.
        Returns:
        maximum speed (inches/sec)

      • setMaxTurnRate

        public void setMaxTurnRate(float mt)
        Set maximum robot turn rate (degrees/sec) limited by LFS maximum value. If the maximum is exceeded, a warning message is generated and the stored value is set to the simulator maximum.
        Parameters:
        mt - maximum turn rate

      • getMaxTurnRate

        public float getMaxTurnRate()
        Get maximum turn rate as specified by user, and possibly limited by simulation.
        Returns:
        (degrees/sec)

      • changeTargetSpeed

        public void changeTargetSpeed(float delta)
        Change speed with no reported error checking, speed is restricted to maxSpeed. Generally setTargetSpeed() method is thought to be more useful for user robot controller.
        Parameters:
        delta - is change (inches/sec)

      • changeTargetSidewaysSpeed

        public void changeTargetSidewaysSpeed(float delta)
        Change target sideways speed with no reported error checking, speed is restricted to maxSpeed. Generally setTargetSidewaysSpeed() method is thought to be more useful for user robot controller.
        Parameters:
        delta - is change (inches/sec)

      • changeTargetTurnRate

        public void changeTargetTurnRate(float delta)
        Change turn rate (deg/sec) with no reported error checking, turn rate is restricted to maxTurnRate. Generally setTargetTurnRate() method is thought to be more useful for user robot controller.
        Parameters:
        delta - is change in (degrees/sec)

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Robot is slowed to stop using pre-set decelRate for speed and turnAcc rate for turn rate.

      • drawRobotLocHeadingVel

        public void drawRobotLocHeadingVel(float x,
                                   float y)
        Draw text of robot location and heading into bitmap. Idea is user does not have direct access to this information. In the real world such data would not be easily obtainable without absolute position and orientation detection. Under certain circumstances this information might be made available

        (Called by simulation core code.)

        Parameters:
        x - Screen X position for location of robot location and heading bitmap.
        y - Screen Y position for location of robot location and heading bitmap.

      • driveUpdate

        public void driveUpdate(boolean stepRequested)
        Called from draw() method, if stepRequseted simulator will calculate new position and heading of robot based on current speed and turn rate.

        (Called by simulation core code.)

        Parameters:
        stepRequested - If true drive update will be called. If false, no driveUpdate and no crumbs will be added.

      • getContestTimeString

        public java.lang.String getContestTimeString()
        Current robot runtime formatted in minutes:seconds:milliseconds (stopwatch tick x timeStep)

        (Called by simulation core code.)

        Returns:
        Contest runtime string mn:se:msec

      • setTimeStep

        public void setTimeStep(float dt)
        Set simulation time step, range 0.1 (10 steps per sec) to 0.01 (100 steps per sec) seconds. If the value of the argument exceeds the legal range, it will be restricted to the given bound. *
        Parameters:
        dt - time step in seconds, default value is 0.01667 (approximately 1/60th second) which corresponds to typical processing frame rate, resulting in robot that runs "the correct speed" when not throttling step rate as is available in the simulation.

      • getTimeStep

        public float getTimeStep()
        Simulation time step in seconds, should not be changed during simulation, recommend change in userInit method.
        Returns:
        timeStep in seconds e.g. 0.01667 is default ~1/60th second

      • setTargetSpeed

        public void setTargetSpeed(float s)
        Set target drive speed where the simulation will ramp up or ramp down using defined acceleration rate or deceleration rate to attain the target speed over succeeding simulation steps.
        Parameters:
        s - Target speed (inches/sec)

      • setInstantSpeed

        public void setInstantSpeed(float s)
        Available only when contest not running. Used by LFS in restoring robot state when clicking on a marker that was generated during a robot non-contest run. That is, a run started by G)o. User is advised to use setTargetSpeed method, as this method does not work if called while contest run is in progress.
        Parameters:
        s - Speed (inches/sec)

      • setInstantSidewaysSpeed

        public void setInstantSidewaysSpeed(float ss)
        Available only when contest not running. Used by LFS in restoring robot state when clicking on a marker that was generated during a robot non-contest run. That is, a run started by G)o. User is advised to use setTargetSidewaysSpeed method, as this method does not work if called while contest run is in progress.
        Parameters:
        ss - Speed (inches/sec)

      • setInstantTurnRate

        public void setInstantTurnRate(float tr)
        Available only when contest not running. Used by LFS in restoring robot state when clicking on a marker that was generated during a robot non-contest run. That is, a run started by G)o. User is advised to use setTargetTurnRate, as this method does not work if called while contest run is in progress.
        Parameters:
        tr - Turn rate (degrees/sec)

      • setTargetSidewaysSpeed

        public void setTargetSidewaysSpeed(float tss)
        Set target sideways drive speed (inches/sec) where the simulation will ramp up or ramp down using defined acceleration rate or deceleration rate to attain the target sideways speed over succeeding simulation steps.
        Parameters:
        tss - Target speed (inches/sec)

      • setTargetTurnRate

        public void setTargetTurnRate(float r)
        Set target turn rate where the simulation will ramp up or ramp down using defined turn acceleration / deceleration rate to attain the target turn rate over succeeding simulation steps.
        Parameters:
        r - Target turn rate (degrees/sec)

      • getSpeed

        public float getSpeed()
        Current robot speed, when less than targetSpeed robot is will be accelerating when greater than target speed, robot is decelerating
        Returns:
        speed (inches/sec)

      • getSidewaysSpeed

        public float getSidewaysSpeed()
        Current robot sideways speed, when less than targetSidewaysSpeed robot is accelerating when greater than target sideways speed, robot is decelerating.
        Returns:
        sideways speed (inches/sec)

      • getHeading

        public float getHeading()
        Current robot heading. Not available during contest run (0 returned)
        Returns:
        current robot heading if contest not running.

      • getTurnRate

        public float getTurnRate()
        Current robot turn rate, when less than targetTurnRate robot is accelerating its turn rate when greater than target turn rate, robot is decelerating its turn rate.
        Returns:
        turn rate (degrees/sec)

      • createSpotSensor

        public SpotSensor createSpotSensor(float xoff,
                                   float yoff,
                                   int w,
                                   int h)
        This method is used to instantiate a new SpotSensor object. Defines the object instance and places it in a list referenced by LFS during the process of updating sensor data (via reading the screen pixels - after the robot view of the course has been rendered to a bitmap.
        Parameters:
        xoff - X offset (inches) from center of robot in robot coordinates. +X axis extends forward.
        yoff - Y offset (inches) from center of robot in robot coordinates. +Y axis extends to right.
        w - width in pixels of spot sensor sampled area of "screen".
        h - height in pixels of spot sensor sampled area of "screen".
        Returns:
        Returns new instance of SpotSensor

      • createLineSensor

        public LineSensor createLineSensor(float xoff,
                                   float yoff,
                                   int w,
                                   int h,
                                   int numberOfSensors)
        This method to instantiate a new LineSensor object. Defines the object instance and places it in a list referenced by LFS during the process of updating sensor data (via reading the screen pixels - after the robot view of the course has been rendered to a bitmap.

        It should be noted the line sensor can be modified into a 1/2 circle sensor array and/or the sensor array can be rotated about the line sensor center spot location at (xoff,yoff).

        Parameters:
        xoff - X offset (inches) from center of robot in robot coordinates. +X axis extends forward.
        yoff - Y offset (inches) from center of robot in robot coordinates. +Y axis extends to right.
        w - width in pixels of spot sensor sampled area of the screen.
        h - height in pixels of spot sensor sampled area of the screen.
        numberOfSensors - number of spots in line (will be incremented if even value specified)
        Returns:
        New instance of LineSensor

      • crumbsEraseAll

        public void crumbsEraseAll()
        Erase crumbs in course view - performed at start of robot run.

        Called by simulation core code and also by keyPress E-EraseCrumbs.

      • drawRobotCoordAxes

        public void drawRobotCoordAxes()
        Draw robot coordinate axes in robot view. Optionally called in userDraw. Serves as a good reminder orientation of robot coordinates and origin when positioning sensors.

      • contestStart

        public void contestStart()
        Called to start contest, controller enabled, crumbs cleared, stopwatch cleared and any rotation bias added to animate optional robot icon is cleared. Reading position and heading prohibited during run as is repositioning robot with setPositionAndHeading.

        (Called by simulation core code.)

      • contestIsRunning

        public boolean contestIsRunning()
        Check to see if contest is running. If so, stopwatch is running, and some restrictions will apply including restriction on moving robot (setPositionAndHeading) and possibly reading robots loction including (getRobotX,getRobotY,getRobotHeading) which are displayed, but not available during robot run in at least one given contest scenario.

        Some consideration may be given to providing location information or local location information which may be reliable for short run. Drive error may be introduced into simulation making local odometry difficult without obtaining calibration references from the couse.

        Returns:
        true if running

      • contestStop

        public void contestStop()
        Stop contest - robot slowed to stop, controller disabled, stop watch stopped. At this point contestFinish() should be called after any further actions taken. It is possible comment dialog will be generated in the future helping to automate process from stop (triggered by SPACE BAR) to contestFinish().

        (Called by simulation core code.)

      • setPositionAndHeading

        public void setPositionAndHeading(float x,
                                  float y,
                                  float heading)
        Set robot position and heading if contest run not in progress.
        Parameters:
        x - robot x location (inches)
        y - robot y location (inches)
        heading - robot heading in degrees

      • getRobotX

        public float getRobotX()
        If contest is not running return robot center, coordinate location X value (inches)
        Returns:
        X (inches)

      • getRobotY

        public float getRobotY()
        If contest is not running return robot center, coordinate location Y value (inches)
        Returns:
        Y (inches)

      • getRobotHeading

        public float getRobotHeading()
        If contest is not running return robot heading value (degrees). Example Headings (along coordinate axes) given. Note course image places its origin in upper-left corner +X axis running to right on the "page" and +Y axis running down the "page" as you would view an image on a screen or paper on a desk. See illustration in User's Guide.

        0 = heading along image X axis in -X direction

        90 = heading along image Y axis in -Y direction

        180 = heading along image X axis in +X direction

        270 = heading along image Y axis in +Y direction

        Returns:
        Heading (degrees)

      • getDistanceTraveled

        public float getDistanceTraveled()
        If contest is not running return robot distance traveled since start. This information is displayed if showDistanceTraveled is set true and reported in contest.cdf if finishIncludesDistance is set true.
        Returns:
        distance traveled since G)o R)un (lib 1.4.1)

      • clearDistanceTraveled

        public void clearDistanceTraveled()
        used when issuing Go or Run command to simulator

      • contestFinish

        public void contestFinish()
        Call after contest stopped (Key F - Finish) Logs run to .cdf file and initiates image save

        (Called by simulation core code.)

      • contestEnd

        public void contestEnd()
        Called internally after contestFinish, or by user program to end contest, skipping report, returning to contest idle (inactive) state.

      • contestScreenSaveIfRequested

        public void contestScreenSaveIfRequested()
        Called at end of sketch draw() method, checks to see if screen save has been requested by simulator and saves image if so.

        (Called by simulation core code.)

      • courseCoordToScreenCoord

        public PVector courseCoordToScreenCoord(float worldX,
                                        float worldY)
        Convert robot location on course to screen x,y coordinates (0,0) top-left of screen
        Parameters:
        worldX - robot world coordinate X value
        worldY - robot world coordinate Y value
        Returns:
        Processing PVector with screen x,y values

      • markerSetup

        public void markerSetup()
        Called from userInit() method to initialize marker system used to allow recording robot start locations and headings within a course. Saved markers are loaded from file with the same name as the loaded course image, except with .mrk extension and subsequently displayed when markerDraw method is called.

        See also : markerAddRemove and markerHandleMouseClick methods.

      • markerDraw

        public void markerDraw()
        Draw markers on to course view as magenta circles. Typically this method is called from userDrawPanel method allowing marker circle display to be turned off (by not calling markerDraw method).

      • markerNotifySavedState

        public void markerNotifySavedState(float x,
                                   float y)
        LFS application gives notice to marker that saved robot state information is present at this marker location. This is done before markerDraw and after marker draw, this notice is cleared.
        Parameters:
        x - Course location X value
        y - Course location Y value

      • markerSavedStateColorScaleSpeed

        public void markerSavedStateColorScaleSpeed(int r,
                                            int g,
                                            int b,
                                            float scale,
                                            float rotationSpeed)
        Animate Saved State Markers (fluff).
        Parameters:
        r - Red component of color 0..255
        r - Green component of color 0..255
        scale - Scale of square
        rotationSpeed - Rotation speed of marker

      • markerHandleMouseClick

        public boolean markerHandleMouseClick()
        This method call should be added to keypressed() method defined in UserKey If method has not been implemented then code would be written:

        void mouseClicked() {

        if (lfs.markerHandleMouseClick()) return;

        // user or other mouse click handlers here

        }

        Returns:
        true if mouse clicked on marker, false if no action taken

      • markerAddRemove

        public boolean markerAddRemove()
        Add / remove marker at current robot location when contest not running. Typically this method is called from keyPressed(), e.g.
        Returns:
        Returns true if marker placed, false if marker removed.

        if (key == 'M') lfs.markerAddRemove();

      • moveToStartLocationAndHeading

        public void moveToStartLocationAndHeading()
        Typically called from userControllerResetAndRun() to locate robot at default location OR marker location if defined and clicked.

      • getStartLocationAndHeading

        public PVector getStartLocationAndHeading()
        Get start location used for contest run. Return as PVector where .x .y are (x,y) location of start point, .z is heading in degrees
        Returns:
        PVector reference to start location and heading, e.g. PVector myStart = getStartLocationAndHeading();

      • showSensors

        public void showSensors(char vportID)
        Show sensors in Robot or Sensor viewport. Displays sensor color data as created (optionally) by user code. Default is green if user does not modify sensor color (or colorTable in case of line sensor).
        Parameters:
        vportID - character 'R' robot viewport 'S' sensor viewport (scaled 64 DPI)

      • setRobotIcon

        public void setRobotIcon(java.lang.String filename,
                         int alpha)
        Define image to be used as robot image on course (replacing blue pointer). Suggest small file 100x100 pixels. Use PNG format with alpha channel where background around robot is transparent.
        Parameters:
        filename - Icon filename located in data folder
        alpha - Icon transparency 0 to 255 0=totally transparent 255=totally opaque

      • setRobotIconImage

        public void setRobotIconImage(PImage img,
                              int alpha)
        Define reference to existing PImage to be used as robot image on course (replacing blue pointer). Suggest image 400x400 or smaller. Use setRobotIconScale method to scale down as needed.
        Parameters:
        img - Reference to PImage
        alpha - Icon transparency 0 to 255 0=totally transparent 255=totally opaque

      • setRobotIconAlpha

        public void setRobotIconAlpha(int alpha)
        Set alpha channel for robot icon image defined by setUserRobotIcon
        Parameters:
        alpha - Icon transparency 0 to 255 0=totally transparent 255=totally opaque

        Parameters:

      • getRobotIconScale

        public float getRobotIconScale()

      • setRobotIconRotationBias

        public void setRobotIconRotationBias(float rotationBias)
        Set robot course icon rotation bias in radians - can be used to animate icon typically after a run. Default bias = 0 and bias is set to 0 at start of a contest run. Positive values rotate icon clockwise. This rotation has no impact on "actual" robot heading.
        Parameters:
        rotationBias - rotation in radians, default 0

      • getRobotIconRotationBias

        public float getRobotIconRotationBias()
        Get robot icon rotation bias in radians.
        Returns:
        robot icon turn bias in radians

      • setMouseActiveInViews

        public void setMouseActiveInViews(boolean enable)
        Control if robot or course viewport respond to mouse. Program disables while variable editor in use which overlaps course view. This is a bit of a hack, while using light-weight viewports.
        Parameters:
        enable - Allow course view and robot view to respond to mouse commands for robot position and heading altering.

      • robotOutOfBounds

        public boolean robotOutOfBounds()
        Return true if robot has driven beyond course extents.
        Returns:
        true if robot outside course bounds

      • setCrumbsVisible

        public void setCrumbsVisible(boolean enable)
        LFS hides crumbs when help visible using this method. Problem with points bleeding through solid rectangle. Drawing order or Z-buffer issue don't know.
        Parameters:
        enable - When true crumbs are drawn.

      • getSimMaxSpeed

        public float getSimMaxSpeed()
        Get simulator imposed maximum robot speed (inches/sec).
        Returns:
        max speed inches/sec

      • getSimMaxTurnRate

        Returns:
        max turn rate (degrees/sec)

      • getSimMaxAcc

        public float getSimMaxAcc()
        Get simulator imposed maximum acceleration rate (inches/sec^2).
        Returns:
        maximum acceleration rate (inches/sec^2).

      • getSimMaxDecel

        public float getSimMaxDecel()
        Get simulator imposed maximum deceleration rate (inches/sec^2).
        Returns:
        maximum deceleration rate (inches/sec^2).

      • getSimMaxTurnAcc

        public float getSimMaxTurnAcc()
        Get simulator impose maximum turn acceleration (and deceleration) rate (deg/sec^2).
        Returns:
        Simulator maximum turn acceleration rate (deg/sec^2).

      • getMinTimeStep

        public float getMinTimeStep()
        Get simulator minimum time step (seconds). This is the amount of time that passes per controller update and also simulator integration time for constant acceleration/deceleration rates applied to calculate speed change and speed integrated to become displacement (distance). This can be faster or slower than real-time. For example at a frame rate of 50 frames per second and a time step of 0.020 (1/50th second), the simulator runs in real time. If the frame rate is 100 frames/second, the simulator would run at 2X realtime.
        Returns:
        Simulator minimum allowable time step (seconds).

      • getMaxTimeStep

        public float getMaxTimeStep()
        Get simulator maximum time step (seconds). See getMinTimeStep method description.
        Returns:
        Simulator maximum allowable time step (seconds).

      • chooseCourseOneTime

        public void chooseCourseOneTime(int num)
        Choose a course defined by defineCouse defineLapCourse methods which specify course number and name. Subsequent calls to this method are ignored. Use chooseCourse method to bypass this "one time" feature.
        Parameters:
        num - Course number

      • chooseCourse

        public void chooseCourse(int num)
        Choose a course defined by defineCouse defineLapCourse methods which specify course number and name. See also chooseCourseOneTime method.
        Parameters:
        num - Course number.

      • chooseNextCourse

        public void chooseNextCourse()
        Choose next course from list created typically in UserInit tab, by defineCourse method calls.

      • defineLapCourse

        public void defineLapCourse(int num,
                            java.lang.String name)
        Define a course that uses lap timer, with no initial position specified. When the course is chosen the robot will be placed in the center. Markers can always be defined to allow quick placement.
        Parameters:
        num - Sequence number.
        name - File name of contest course .png or .jpg image file expected to be scaled to 64 DPI and located in sketch data sub-folder.

      • defineCourse

        public void defineCourse(int num,
                         java.lang.String name)
        Define a course that does not use lap timer, with no initial position specified. When the course is chosen the robot will be placed in the center. Markers can always be defined to allow quick placement.
        Parameters:
        num - Sequence number.
        name - File name of contest course .png or .jpg image file expected to be scaled to 64 DPI and located in sketch data sub-folder.

      • defineLapCourse

        public void defineLapCourse(int num,
                            java.lang.String name,
                            float x,
                            float y,
                            float heading)
        Define a course that uses lap timer, with initial position and heading specified. When the course is chosen the robot will be placed at the location specified.
        Parameters:
        num - Sequence number.
        name - File name of contest course .png or .jpg image file expected to be scaled to 64 DPI and located in sketch data sub-folder.
        x - Robot Offset (inches) in course image
        y - Robot Offset (inches) in course image
        heading - Robot heading 0..359 (degrees)

      • defineCourse

        public void defineCourse(int num,
                         java.lang.String name,
                         float x,
                         float y,
                         float heading)
        Define a course that does not use lap timer, with initial position and heading specified. When the course is chosen the robot will be placed at the location specified.
        Parameters:
        num - Sequence number.
        name - File name of contest course .png or .jpg image file expected to be scaled to 64 DPI and located in sketch data sub-folder.
        x - Robot Offset (inches) in course image
        y - Robot Offset (inches) in course image
        heading - Robot heading 0..359 (degrees)
